In the [[Christianity|Christian]] [[Bible]] and [[Judaism|Jewish]] scripture, wisdom is represented by the sense of justice of the lawful and wise king [[Solomon]], who asks God for wisdom in [[1 Kings]] 3. Much of the [[Book of Proverbs]], a book of wise sayings, is attributed to Solomon. In Proverbs 1:7 and 9:10, the [[Fear of the lord|fear of the Lord]] is called the beginning or foundation of wisdom while Proverbs 8:13 declares "To fear the Lord is to hate evil". In Proverbs 1:20, there is also reference to wisdom personified in female form, "Wisdom calls aloud in the street, she raises her voice in the public squares."

''From Wisdom's horn/Authority is born''.
+
However this is most likely a mistranslation of the Hebrew 'Keren' while means 'pride/defiance' (Psalm 75:5) in the emotive context but 'animal horn' in the vulgate. Possibly one of the most famous examples of this error led Michael Angelo to add horns to his statue of Moses.
    −
''His Wisdom shone ('''qaran''') unto them like a horn ('''qeren''') of light''.
+
In this context, once can clearly see the same misinterpretation in the following examples:
  +
''From Wisdom's (Pride/Defiance/an animal horn)/Authority is born''.
  +
''His Wisdom shone ('''qaran''') unto them like (Pride/Defiance/an animal horn) ('''qeren''') of light''.
